text: What could be the next evolution after OOP?
Today we can look back on the evolution of computer science and see structural programming, functional programming, and finally object-oriented programming.
Additionally, things like meta-programming (reflective programming) and combining approaches into a single language (e.g.
Another trend is template-meta-programming (though implemented in C++ long ago) and the advent of dynamic languages (ruby, python).

lis.text: Will OOP be replaced by some new programming paradigm?
What problems does OOP have that new paradigms will need to address?
